svo_sov_rules.transformation: When translating from English (SVO) to Indian languages (SOV), move verb to end of clause

auxiliary_verb_rules.hindi_handling: Merge auxiliary with main verb or replace with appropriate form
auxiliary_verb_rules.telugu_handling: Merge or omit based on tense requirement
auxiliary_verb_rules.tamil_handling: Merge with main verb in suffix form
auxiliary_verb_rules.example: I am reading → मैं पढ़ रहा हूँ (pढ़ रहा हूँ includes 'am' meaning)

telugu.description: Telugu nouns have gender reflected in adjectives
telugu.marking: Gender shown in agreement with adjectives

tamil.description: Tamil marks gender in verbs and adjectives

hindi.description: Hindi verbs change based on subject, tense, and aspect

telugu.description: Telugu verbs conjugate based on person and tense

tamil.description: Tamil verbs show tense through suffix

linguistic_analysis.auxiliary_merging: Combine auxiliary verbs with main verbs when translating to Indian languages
linguistic_analysis.word_order_change: English SVO becomes Indian SOV - move verb to end
linguistic_analysis.tense_preservation: Extract tense from auxiliary and apply to verb conjugation in target language

explanation_templates.svo_to_sov: The word order changed from English SVO (Subject-Verb-Object) to {language} SOV (Subject-Object-Verb). The verb moved to the end of the sentence.
explanation_templates.auxiliary_merge: The auxiliary verb '{aux}' was merged with the main verb '{verb}' in the target language because {reason}.
explanation_templates.tense_change: The tense '{english_tense}' was expressed through verb conjugation in the target language.
explanation_templates.gender_agreement: The word '{word}' took a {gender} form to agree with the noun it modifies.
explanation_templates.unknown_word: The word '{word}' was not found in the dictionary. It is shown as-is in the translation.
